Finally, while we view international and M&A-related growth strategies as representing through-the-cycle growth tailwinds, we do see the potential for increased complexity/operational risk as the company pursues these strategies. Parker Hannifin Company description

Led by CEO and Chairman Jennifer Parmentier, Parker Hannifin (PH) is a leading global manufacturer of a wide range of motion control and fluid power technologies for industrial and aerospace applications. The company operates in two main business segments: the Industrial segments (roughly ~72% sales, divided regionally in North America and International) produces hydraulic, pneumatic, and electromechanical components as well as related hoses, valves, seals, and filters for both mobile and stationary industrial applications; the Aerospace division (~28% of sales) was nearly doubled with the acquisition of Meggitt, produces flight controls, hydraulic components, fire & safety and fuel & fluid conveyances systems for the commercial and military aerospace markets. Investment strategy

We rate shares of PH a Buy. We view PH as well-positioned to deliver organic growth in-line with its long-term targets as we think it has properly balanced short-cycle exposure (~25% of FY24 sales), which is likely to recover mid-year in 2025, and longer-cycle/more durable exposure (~75% of FY24 sales). Coupled with continued margin expansion potential as PH continues executing its Win Strategy 3.0 across its business (both legacy and potential acquisition targets), we see the company as well-positioned for earnings growth over the next several years. Valuation Our $1,074 price target is based on a ~32x P/E multiple on our FY27 EPS estimate of $33.15. While our target multiple represents a premium to PH's primary comps, we anticipate likely outsized earnings growth vs. most peers as PH continues executing on its portfolio transformation, driving improvements to underlying profitability and creating shareholder value through its capital deployment strategy. Risks

Risks to achieving our target price are as follows: muted economic outlooks internationally (China and Germany/Eurozone) could put downward pressure on our International Diversified Industrial segment estimates; a combination of short-and-medium term risks in the Aerospace industry could impact the segment's organic revenue (despite solid performance in the past couple of years); and increasing M&A deal sizes (vs. historical average acquired company revenues) could increase potential integration risks on what we think are high expectations (reflected in PH's elevated valuation). Pentair PLC Company description Pentair delivers a comprehensive range of smart, sustainable water solutions to homes, business and industry around the world. Pentair is comprised of three reportable business segments: Pool, Water Solutions and Industrial & Flow Technologies. Pentair is incorporated in Ireland and its main U.S. office location is in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Investment strategy

We rate shares of Pentair as a Buy. Pentair’s top-three position in the highly concentrated pool end market should benefit PNR’s pool business, which is ~80% replacement driven and should see healthy break and fix demand from the larging aging installed base of pools (5.4mn in NA). Additionally, PNR’s long runway for growth in residential & commercial filtration should enable the company to grow as a water pure play with solid incremental margins over time. That said, we think there are risks to Pentair from the company being in the early innings of accomplishing its residential /commercial filtration strategy and what we view as exposure to more cyclical commercial/industrial end markets (~50% as of 2022 sales). Overall, we think Pentair’s stock price represents an opportunity for share price appreciation, although likely remains at a discount to water industry peers. Valuation

We assign a $126 target price to PNR based on a 21x multiple applied to our '27 estimate of $6.00, slightly below Pentair’s peer average of ~25x, with the discount reflecting PNR being in the early stages of expanding into the competitive end market of residential & commercial filtration, as well as exposure to more cyclical commercial & industrial end markets (~50% as of 2022 sales). Risks We view the following risks as material to the achievement of our target price: Reduced demand (particularly in non-res end markets) as well as related impacts on PNR’s production facilities/supply chain could meaningfully mute results in the near term. The company operates in a highly competitive residential & commercial filtration end market, with what we view as low barriers to entry from technology. The company is subject to fluctuation in weather as well as some general macro cyclicality. Also, within the pool end market, we view the pool installed base as slow-growing over time and a sizable customer concentration (~20%).

If the impact on the company from any of these factors proves to be greater than we anticipate, we believe the stock will likely have difficulty achieving our target price. Ralliant Corp Company description Ralliant (RAL) is a global technology company that designs, develops, manufactures and services precision instruments and highly engineered products. The company operates through two segments – Test and Measurement (T&M) and Sensors and Safety Systems (S&SS) that comprise of various brands including Tektronix, Keithley Instruments, EA Elektro-Automatik, Qualitrol, Gems Sensors, Setra Systems, and others. Its products include Oscilloscopes, Probes, High-power bi-directional power supplies, advanced monitoring, protection, and diagnostic solutions and customers include engineers at industry leading companies, research institutions, and governments, across semiconductor, datacenter, consumer electronics, automotive, energy storage, aero, defense and space, utilities, industrial manufacturing, and other industries. The company is based in Raleigh, North Carolina. Investment strategy

We rate RAL shares Buy. We think RAL’s separation from FTV should unlock value over time as RAL exhibits some key characteristics for long-term success – solid brand/product portfolio, secular growth drivers, a well-established operating system, and a healthy balance sheet. RAL’s exposure to some cyclical end markets along with lingering macro uncertainty create a challenging backdrop in the near-term, but early signs of demand stabilization/inflection across cyclically softer end markets coupled with margin expansion potential (volume leverage + RBS) and capital deployment optionality should support solid earnings growth potential. Valuation

We have a target price of $61 on RAL that represents a 20x P/E valuation multiple on our 2027 EPS estimate of $3.05. Our target multiple reflects a discount to the company’s comps (currently on average of ~21.5x) but mostly inline with the S&P 500 (currently at ~19.5x) and reflects RAL’s improving earnings growth potential despite some cyclical aspects of its portfolio (vs. other close peers). Risks Based on Citi’s Quant Risk Rating Model, the stock screens High Risk (given lack of trading history) but we don’t believe that a High Risk rating is warranted as we think RAL has been operated (under FTV) as part of a public company and exhibits steady fundamentals that we think will limit significant stock volatility. Risks that could cause the shares to fall short of our target price

: RAL's select end markets and regions have been relatively soft/weak and a potentially elongated challenging demand environment could pressure/extend the path to RAL's sales growth recovery. RAL's relatively high exposure to China and given the growing tensions between the two regions (if not resolved) could lead to a continuation of pressured growth in the region (RAL is not allowed to sell to select customers in China). If overall sales growth and volume characteristics remain soft for RAL over a longer timeframe, margin recovery could be below our model in '26/'27. Trane Technologies Plc Company description Trane Technologies is a global company that provides HVAC products, services, and solutions through its strategic brands Trane and Thermo King. The company operates its business and reports its financials through a regional segment structure comprised of the Americas segment, the Europe, Middle East and Africa (EMEA) segment, and the Asia Pacific segment. The company is headquartered in Swords, Ireland. Investment strategy

We rate TT shares as a Buy. We believe there are significant long-term tailwinds stemming from an increased focus on energy efficiency/decarbonization and lowering greenhouse gas emissions that should help support growth. TT's diverse exposure to better-positioned end markets within Multi-Industry (eg, U.S. Commercial HVAC, Transport Refrigeration), improving/strong execution, and solid cash/capital deployment potential should support solid EPS growth over time. Valuation Our $513 target price is based on a ~32x multiple applied to our 2027 adj. EPS estimate of $16.20. We believe the secular tailwind from the rising focus on energy efficiency/climate change and lowering greenhouse gas emissions, combined with solid end markets, should enable a multi-year earnings runway for TT. Risks

Risks to TT not achieving our target price include potential for a steeper pullback in U.S. non-residential construction and/or Transport Refrigeration beyond our expectations. Reasons TT could surpass our target price include if non-residential construction grows beyond our expectation or if the company is able to extract synergies faster/higher than our forecast. Veralto Corp Company description VLTO is a global industrial company focused on water quality and product identification solutions, consisting of two segments: 1) Water Quality, offering analytical instrumentation, treatment equipment, chemicals, and software for municipal, commercial, and industrial water testing and treatment; and 2) Product Quality & Innovation, providing technologies for product coding, packaging, traceability, and color quality assurance for consumer goods and industrial manufacturers. Investment strategy

We rate VLTO's shares Neutral. We remain constructive on the LT outlook for water and product end-markets, which should provide VLTO resilient MSD organic growth over time, though we view VLTO’s current valuation as largely reflecting the longer-term optimism on the company’s ability to capture/deliver growth inline with its LT targets – MSD organic growth, augmented with M&A, and ~30-35%+ adj operating incremental margins. Valuation Our $111 target price is based on a blended SOTP multiple of ~18x EV/EBITDA on our 2027 adj. EBITDA estimate of $1.59bn. We believe our premium multiple (vs other Industrial companies in our space) is justified due to what we view as a high-quality management team running a portfolio with leading positions in attractive niche markets levered to attractive secular growth trends in regulation, sustainability and supply chain digitization. Risks

Key downside risks that could cause VLTO shares to trade below our target price include macro uncertainty lasting longer than expected and continuing to impact demand domestically and abroad, which will in turn hold down VLTO’s earnings. Additionally, inconsistent or slower-than-expected progress on adj operating margin expansion could result in more moderate EPS growth vs our expectations. Lastly, while M&A is an important aspect of VTLO’s strategy, we also consider an acquisition-driven growth strategy as representing a higher level of risk vs. a more organically driven growth model given risks such as the potential for execution/integration mis-steps, or the potential to overpay for targets (amongst others). While we think a LT track record of M&A-oriented growth is encouraging, we do think VLTO’s ability to extend its M&A playbook as a standalone company remains to be seen.

Key upside risks to our TP include: strong organic growth led by better-than-expected macro conditions helping organic growth exceed our MSD LT expectations; VES initiatives taking hold faster than expected and growing incremental margins in excess of 30-35% we are currently modelling; and accretive M&A could be an earnings tailwind as we currently do not forecast inorganic growth. Vertiv Holdings Co Company description Vertiv is a global leader engaged in the design, manufacturing, and servicing of critical digital infrastructure technology that powers, cools, deploys, secures and maintains electronics that process, store and transmit data. It also offers power management products, thermal management products, integrated rack systems, modular solutions, and management systems for monitoring and controlling digital infrastructure. It carries out its operations in the following geographical segments: Americas, Asia Pacific, and EMEA. Vertiv is headquartered in Columbus, Ohio, and has ~20,000 employees, 19 manufacturing sites, and 270+ service centers around the world. Investment strategy

We rate VRT as Buy given its industry-leading position in end markets that see secular growth tailwinds, margin expansion potential, and M&A opportunity that could support a multi-year earnings expansion path. With a portfolio of dedicated products and services for power, thermal and infrastructure management, global sales/services capabilities, and ~60% recurring sales on a growing installed base, we expect VRT to grow at an above-industry average rate of HSD+ over the next few years. Valuation Our $220 target price is based on a ~24x EV/EBITDA multiple applied to our 2027 adjusted EBITDA estimate of ~$3,680mn. Our ~24x target multiple is modestly higher than VRT’s average peers’ valuation, which we think represents fair value given the increasing potential of generative AI to accelerate the overall data center market and VRT’s medium- to longer-term growth, as well as its improving execution. Risks

The stock screens as High Risk per Citi’s Quant model, but we don’t think a High Risk qualifier is justified due to VRT’s improving execution and visibility into earnings growth given the increasing potential of generative AI to accelerate the overall data center market and VRT’s medium- to longer-term growth. Key risks to our view and TP include: 1) lingering supply chain/logistics headwinds, which could pressure top-line growth, while inflationary pressures could weigh on margin; and 2) there is also some concern over weaker telecom exposure (20%+ of sales) and macro choppiness in China (low teens of sales). If the impact on the company from any of these factors proves to be more negative than we anticipate, the stock could materially underperform our target price. Vontier Corporation Company description

Vontier is a global industrial technology company that focuses on critical technical equipment, components, software and services for manufacturing, repair, and servicing in the mobility infrastructure industry worldwide. The company supplies a wide range of solutions, spanning advanced environmental sensors, fueling equipment, field payment hardware, remote management and workflow software, vehicle tracking and fleet management software solutions for traffic light control and vehicle mechanics’ and technicians’ equipment. VNT’s products and services are marketed to retail and commercial fueling operators, commercial vehicle repair businesses, municipal governments and public safety entities and fleet owners/operators on a global basis. Investment strategy We rate VNT shares as a Buy given what we view as good long-term growth potential supported by solid market positions in its end markets and potential for accelerating growth as M&A capital deployment ramps up over the next several years. Valuation

Our $50 price target is based on a 11x EV/EBITDA multiple applied to our 2027 adjusted EBITDA estimate of ~$815mn. With an overweighting to retail fueling vs. peers, our price target multiple is modestly below VNT’s overall comp group. Risks While VNT screens as High Risk in our Quant model due to its lack of trading history as a standalone company, given the company’s strong FCF generation and more moderate cyclicality vs. some industrial peers, VNT shares do not, in our view, warrant a High Risk rating. Risks to the downside that could impede the stock from reaching our target price include steeper-than-expected headwinds in VNT’s North American retail fueling business as a regulatory-driven up-cycle nears completion and/or more moderate global economic recovery vs. our current expectations. VNT’s M&A-oriented long-term growth strategy also poses risks related to potentially overpaying for acquisition targets and/or mis-executing merger integrations. Xylem Inc Company description

Xylem Inc. is a leading equipment and service provider for water and wastewater applications with a broad portfolio of products and services addressing the full cycle of water, from collection, distribution, and use to the return of water to the environment. Xylem operates in three segments: Water Infrastructure, Applied Water, and Measurement & Control Solutions. Xylem’s corporate headquarters are in Rye Brook, New York. Investment strategy We rate shares of Xylem a Buy. Favorable long-term trends in XYL’s global water-related end markets should be supportive of good topline trends over time (despite some potential N-T demand choppiness), and we are increasingly confident that XYL’s operational execution continues to improve and should be supportive of continued margin expansion potential, particularly as relatively nascent 80/20 efforts continue to build momentum. Cash deployment optionality could also be a tailwind over time given XYL’s BS strength. Valuation

Our $182 target price is based on 30x our 2027 EPS estimate of $6.00. We believe Xylem’s competitive position, broad portfolio, and self-help opportunities continue to justify a premium multiple compared to the average of its peers (peers trade in the range of 14x-42x of 2026E EPS). Risks We acknowledge some risks relative to XYL’s “normalizing” growth, particularly in Measurement & Control Solutions (M&CS) business given recent commentary indicating some “pockets of softness” in Europe and emerging markets that, coupled with some cyclicality in other portions of XYL’s portfolio (such as Applied Water and Water Solution & Services), could contribute to relatively meaningful quarter-to-quarter volatility in organic growth. That said, if the impact on the company from any of these factors proves to be more negative than we anticipate, the stock will likely have difficulty achieving our financial and price targets. Likewise, if any of these factors proves to have less of an effect than we anticipate, the stock could materially outperform our target.

Zebra Technologies Corp. (ZBRA) engages in the design, manufacture, and sale of products in the Automatic Identification and Data Capture (AIDC) industry. Its products include mobile computers, barcode scanners, radio frequency identification devices (RFID), specialty printers for barcode labeling and personal identification, real-time location systems (RTLS), accessories and supplies, and software utilities and applications. ZBRA also provides machine vision and robotics automation solutions. The company’s solutions help its customers and end-users to digitize and automate their workflows to achieve their critical business objectives (including improved productivity and operational efficiency, optimized regulatory compliance, and better customer experiences). The company operates through two segments: Asset Intelligence and Tracking (AIT) and Enterprise Visibility and Mobility (EVM). The AIT segment offers solutions across barcode and card printing, RFID and RTLS, supplies, and services. The EVM segment focuses on mobile computing, data capture, fixed industrial scanning, and machine vision, services, and workflow optimization solutions. The company is headquartered in Lincolnshire, IL.

Investment strategy We rate ZBRA shares Neutral. We view ZBRA’s strong market positioning and an evolving portfolio of products and services in addition to enduring longer-term benefits from automation/digitization adoption trends as supporting 5-7% over-the-cycle sales growth although still somewhat mixed/cautious consumer sentiment and capex budget tightness combined with discretionary nature of automation spend add to our caution. Additionally, recent M&A assets, while strategic in nature, are still in the “show-me” camp, in our view, and that, combined with somewhat elevated valuation levels, keeps us on the sidelines. Valuation Our $311 target price is based on a 16x P/E multiple on our 2027 adj. EPS estimate. Our target multiple is slightly below ZBRA’s LT average (~18x) and below S&P 500 (2027 expected P/E multiple ~19x), and balances ZBRA’s exposure to some durable LT demand trends and market leadership in key markets with some “show me” elements given some near-term economic

uncertainty, potential for margin expansion (especially given inflation and tariff-related headwinds), and M&A asset contribution. Risks Risks that could cause the shares to fall short of our target price: Uncertain macro environment and discretionary nature of automation spend could slow/delay larger projects as well as limit scaled adoption of ZBRA’s high growth vectors. Softer volume could lead to margin pressure and impact profitability. Tariffs on imports could lead to margin pressure. Higher risk M&A, if failed to materialize, could lead to incremental earnings headwinds. Upside risks to our target price: Continued recovery in demand across ZBRA’s end markets support project activity across larger projects, as well as an increase software, robotics, or vision adoption supporting incremental earnings growth. A US-China trade deal could lower tariff headwinds.

Data current as of 01 Jan 2026 Buy Hold Sell Buy Hold Sell Citi Research Global Fundamental Coverage (Neutral=Hold) 60% 32% 8% 37% 47% 16% % of companies in each rating category that are investment banking clients 36% 40% 28% 40% 34% 35% Guide to Citi Research Fundamental Research Investment Ratings: Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks. Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned. Investment Ratings:

Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of 15% or more or 25% or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign “Rating Suspended” status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as “—“ and “-“ respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned “Under Review” status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re-establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short-term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near-term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds 15% against the direction of the call (unless over-ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock’s fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer-term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings-distribution-disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution-disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share-price movement will not materialize as expected.

The securities of non-U.S. issuers may not be registered with, nor be subject to the reporting requirements of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. There may be limited information available on foreign securities. In addition, exchange rate movements may have an adverse effect on the value of an investment in a foreign stock and its corresponding dividend payment for U.S. investors. Card Insights . Where this report references Card Insights data, Card Insights consists of selected data from a subset of Citi’s proprietary credit card transactions. Such data has undergone rigorous security protocols to keep all customer information confidential and secure; the data is highly aggregated and anonymized so that all unique customer identifiable information is removed from the data prior to receipt by the report’s author or distribution to external parties. This data should be considered in the context of other economic indicators and publicly available information. Further, the selected data represents only a subset of Citi’s proprietary credit card transactions due to the selection methodology or other limitations and should not be considered as indicative or predictive of the past or future financial performance of Citi or its credit card business.
